terms.definition: How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth. (NCI)
terms.preferredTerm: Age

terms.definition: An arbitrary classification of a taxonomic group that is a division of the human species.
terms.preferredTerm: Race

terms.definition: The assemblage of properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female.
terms.preferredTerm: Sex

terms.definition: A characterization or categorization of the tobacco product.
terms.preferredTerm: Tobacco Product Category

terms.definition: The usage status of a tobacco product(s) after a change in use of any tobacco product(s).
terms.preferredTerm: Post-Transition Tobacco Product Use Status

terms.definition: The usage status of a tobacco product(s) prior to a change in use of any tobacco product(s).
terms.preferredTerm: Pre-Transition Tobacco Product Use Status

terms.definition: The condition or status of usage of a tobacco product(s).
terms.preferredTerm: Tobacco Product Use Status

terms.definition: A characterization or categorization of the change from one tobacco product use state to another.
terms.preferredTerm: Tobacco Product Use Transition Type

terms.definition: A year period of time, which may be historical or projected, that is used for the purpose of defining a projection period.
terms.preferredTerm: Year Projection Period

terms.definition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - How many hours in a typical 24-hour day do you have someone with you to provide physical assistance for personal care activities such as eating, bathing, dressing, toileting and mobility? (hours paid assistance).
terms.preferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Paid Personal Care per Day

terms.definition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - How many hours in a typical 24-hour day do you have someone with you to provide physical assistance for personal care activities such as eating, bathing, dressing, toileting and mobility? hours unpaid (family, others).
terms.preferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Unpaid Personal Care per Day

terms.definition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - How much time is someone with you in your home to assist you with activities that require remembering, decision making, or judgment?
terms.preferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Home Cognitive Assistance per Day

terms.definition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - How much of the time is someone with you to help you with remembering, decision making, or judgment when you go away from your home?
terms.preferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Away Cognitive Assistance per Day

codelists.definition: Date Imputation Flag: Indicates the level of imputation reflected in a date value.
codelists.name: Date Imputation Flag
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Date Imputation Flag Terminology

terms.definition: Day Imputed: Day is imputed.
terms.preferredTerm: Day Imputed

terms.definition: Month Imputed: Month and day are imputed.
terms.preferredTerm: Month Day Imputed

terms.definition: Year Imputed: Entire date (year, month and day) is imputed.
terms.preferredTerm: Year Month Day Imputed

codelists.definition: Derivation Type: Analysis value derivation method.
codelists.name: Derivation Type
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Derivation Type Terminology

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's average value over a defined set of records.
terms.preferredTerm: Average of Value Derivation Technique

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the best possible outcome.
terms.preferredTerm: Best Case Imputation Technique

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's non-missing baseline observation.
terms.preferredTerm: Baseline Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the best outcome recorded within a subject.
terms.preferredTerm: Best Observed Case Imputation Technique

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's previous best-case non-missing value.
terms.preferredTerm: Best Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

terms.definition: A technique that uses assignment logic to duplicate an analysis value to be used in additional evaluations.
terms.preferredTerm: Copy Duplication Imputation Technique

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to an estimated or assumed value based on extending a known sequence of values. This category also includes conditionally branched questions where an actual response is imputed.
terms.preferredTerm: Extrapolation Imputation Technique

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to one half of the lower limit of quantification of a test.
terms.preferredTerm: One Half of Lower Limit of Quantification Derivation Technique
synonyms: One Half of Lower Limit of Quantification

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to a function of known values to estimate a value within the range.
terms.preferredTerm: Interpolation Imputation Technique

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the lower limit of detection of a test.
terms.preferredTerm: Detection Limit

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the lower limit of quantification of a test.
terms.preferredTerm: Lower Limit of Quantification Derivation Technique

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's previous non-missing value.
terms.preferredTerm: Last Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's last recorded non-missing observation.
terms.preferredTerm: Last Observed Value Imputation Technique

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's last observed value prior to the start of study treatment.
terms.preferredTerm: Last Value Prior to Dosing Imputation Technique

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's maximum value over a defined set of records.
terms.preferredTerm: Maximum Value Derivation Technique

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's minimum value over a defined set of records.
terms.preferredTerm: Minimum Value Derivation Technique

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the estimate that maximizes the probability of observing what has in fact been observed.
terms.preferredTerm: Maximum Likelihood Estimation

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the mean value from a comparator or reference group.
terms.preferredTerm: Mean of Other Group Imputation Technique

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the mean value observed in a group of subjects.
terms.preferredTerm: Mean Observed Value in a Group Imputation Technique
synonyms: Mean Observed Value in a Group

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's next non-missing value.
terms.preferredTerm: Next Observation Carried Backward Imputation Technique

terms.definition: A technique that creates a record with a missing analysis value when there is no observed record for a given analysis visit or analysis timepoint.
terms.preferredTerm: Phantom Record Imputation Technique

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's next-to-last non-missing value.
terms.preferredTerm: Penultimate Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's non-missing screening observation.
terms.preferredTerm: Screening Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the upper limit of detection of a test.
terms.preferredTerm: Upper Limit of Detection Imputation Technique

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the upper limit of quantification of a test.
terms.preferredTerm: Upper Limit of Quantification Derivation Technique

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the worst possible outcome.
terms.preferredTerm: Worst Case Imputation Technique

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the worst recorded outcome within a subject.
terms.preferredTerm: Worst Observed Case Imputation Technique

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's worst-case non-missing observation.
terms.preferredTerm: Worst Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

terms.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the worst value observed in a group of subjects.
terms.preferredTerm: Worst Observed Value in a Group Imputation Technique
synonyms: Worst Observed Value in a Group

terms.preferredTerm: Hamilton Depression Rating Scale - 17 Item - Total Score for Analysis

codelists.definition: A terminology codelist containing the input parameters for an analysis.
codelists.name: Input Parameter
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Input Parameter Terminology

terms.definition: The ratio of total births to the total population during a specified time period.
terms.preferredTerm: Birth Rate

terms.definition: Probability of individuals with defined demographic characteristics and tobacco use status that die in a specified time interval. (Vugrin ED, Rostron BL, Verzi SJ, Brodsky NS, Brown TJ, Choiniere CJ, Coleman BN, Paredes A, Apelberg BJ. Modeling the potential effects of new tobacco products and policies: a dynamic population model for multiple product use and harm. PLoS One. 2015 Mar 27;10(3):e0121008.)
terms.preferredTerm: Tobacco Use Status Mortality Probability

terms.definition: Annual number of net international migrants entering/leaving during the time interval per person in the population. (Vugrin ED, Rostron BL, Verzi SJ, Brodsky NS, Brown TJ, Choiniere CJ, Coleman BN, Paredes A, Apelberg BJ. Modeling the potential effects of new tobacco products and policies: a dynamic population model for multiple product use and harm. PLoS One. 2015 Mar 27;10(3):e0121008.)
terms.preferredTerm: Net Migration Rate

terms.definition: An absolute count of the number of individuals within a population group.
terms.preferredTerm: Population Count

terms.definition: The proportion of persons in a population who have a particular disease or attribute at a specified point in time or over a specified period of time. (CDC)
terms.preferredTerm: Prevalence

terms.definition: Probability of individuals with defined demographic characteristics and tobacco use status that transition their tobacco use status in the specified time interval. (Vugrin ED, Rostron BL, Verzi SJ, Brodsky NS, Brown TJ, Choiniere CJ, Coleman BN, Paredes A, Apelberg BJ. Modeling the potential effects of new tobacco products and policies: a dynamic population model for multiple product use and harm. PLoS One. 2015 Mar 27;10(3):e0121008.)
terms.preferredTerm: Tobacco Use Transition Probability

codelists.definition: A parameter code codelist for the National Early Warning Score 2 Clinical Classification (NEWS2) to support the calculation of total score in ADaM.
codelists.name: National Early Warning Score 2 Clinical Classification Parameter Code
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC ADaM National Early Warning Score 2 Clinical Classification Parameter Code Terminology
synonyms: National Early Warning Score 2 Clinical Classification Parameter Code

terms.definition: National Early Warning Score 2 - Trigger used for analysis.
terms.preferredTerm: National Early Warning Score 2 - Trigger for Analysis

terms.definition: National Early Warning Score 2 - Total score used for analysis.
terms.preferredTerm: National Early Warning Score 2 - Total Score for Analysis

codelists.definition: A parameter name codelist for the National Early Warning Score 2 Clinical Classification (NEWS2) to support the calculation of total score in ADaM.
codelists.name: National Early Warning Score 2 Clinical Classification Parameter Name
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC ADaM National Early Warning Score 2 Clinical Classification Parameter Name Terminology
synonyms: National Early Warning Score 2 Clinical Classification Parameter Name

terms.definition: National Early Warning Score 2 - Total score used for analysis.
terms.preferredTerm: National Early Warning Score 2 - Total Score for Analysis

terms.definition: National Early Warning Score 2 - Trigger used for analysis.
terms.preferredTerm: National Early Warning Score 2 - Trigger for Analysis

codelists.definition: Parameter Type: Indicates whether the parameter is derived as a function of one or more other parameters.
codelists.name: Parameter Type
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Parameter Type Terminology

terms.definition: Derived: Indicates that a parameter is derived as a function of one or more other parameters.
terms.preferredTerm: Derived Flag

codelists.definition: Terminology relevant to the name of the Pool, often defined in the integrated statistical analysis plan, which identifies the combination of subjects' clinical trial experience and will be the focus of the integrated analysis.
codelists.name: Pool for Integration
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Pool for Integration Terminology

terms.definition: The pool that includes data across all studies within which the subject has participated, used for the overall integrated analysis.
terms.preferredTerm: Overall Pooled Data

codelists.definition: Indicates the status of the subject in the trial.
codelists.name: Subject Trial Status
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Subject Trial Status Terminology

terms.definition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion. (NCI)
terms.preferredTerm: Complete

terms.definition: To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.
terms.preferredTerm: Discontinue

terms.definition: Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption. (NCI)
terms.preferredTerm: Continue

codelists.definition: Time Imputation Flag: Indicates the level of imputation reflected in a time value.
codelists.name: Time Imputation Flag
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Time Imputation Flag Terminology

terms.definition: Hours Imputed: Entire time (hours, minutes and seconds) is imputed.
terms.preferredTerm: Hours Minutes Seconds Imputed

terms.definition: Minutes Imputed: Minutes and seconds are imputed.
terms.preferredTerm: Minutes Seconds Imputed

terms.definition: Seconds Imputed: Seconds are imputed.
terms.preferredTerm: Seconds Imputed

codelists.definition: A terminology codelist containing the responses for a tobacco product category.
codelists.name: Tobacco Product Category Response
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Tobacco Product Category Response Terminology

terms.definition: A tobacco product that meets the definition of the term "cigarette" in section 3(1) of the Federal Cigarette Labeling and Advertising Act (any roll of tobacco wrapped in paper or in any substance not containing tobacco), and includes tobacco, in any form, that is functional in the product, which, because of its appearance, the type of tobacco used in the filler, or its packaging and labeling, is likely to be offered to, or purchased by, consumers as a cigarette or as roll-your-own tobacco (FD&C Act Section 900(3); 15 U.S.C. Ch. 36: CIGARETTE LABELING AND ADVERTISING). Note: The US FDA uses the term "cigarettes" to refer to combusted cigarettes, unless specifically stated otherwise. In general, the term is not meant to include any noncombusted tobacco products that meet the definition of cigarette in Section 900(3) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. Section 387(3)).
terms.preferredTerm: Cigarette

terms.definition: A tobacco product that (1) is not a cigarette and (2) is a roll of tobacco wrapped in leaf tobacco or any substance containing tobacco. (FDA CTP Glossary; 26 U.S.C. Section 5702(a))
terms.preferredTerm: Cigar

terms.definition: A tobacco product that is a device used to deliver e-liquid in aerosol form for inhalation. (FDA CTP Glossary)
terms.preferredTerm: Electronic Nicotine Delivery Device

codelists.definition: A terminology codelist containing the responses for tobacco product use status.
codelists.name: Tobacco Product Use Status Response
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Tobacco Product Use Status Response Terminology

terms.definition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time. (NCI)
terms.preferredTerm: Current

terms.definition: Occurring prior to something else. (NCI)
terms.preferredTerm: Previous

terms.definition: Not ever; at no time in the past.
terms.preferredTerm: Never

codelists.definition: A terminology codelist containing the responses for tobacco use transition.
codelists.name: Tobacco Use Transition Response
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Tobacco Use Transition Response Terminology

terms.definition: The act of ceasing use of a tobacco product temporarily or permanently (moving from 'Current to 'Former' tobacco product use state).
terms.preferredTerm: Tobacco Product Use Cessation

terms.definition: The act of starting use (i.e., meeting the criteria of usage) of a tobacco product that has never been used before (moving from 'Never' to 'Current' tobacco product use state).
terms.preferredTerm: Tobacco Product Use Initiation

terms.definition: The act of re-starting use of a tobacco product after a period of product use cessation (moving from 'Former' to 'Current' tobacco product use state).
terms.preferredTerm: Tobacco Product Use Relapse

terms.definition: The act of replacing one tobacco product with another.
terms.preferredTerm: Tobacco Product Use Switching

description: CDISC Controlled Terminology for ADaM is the set of CDISC-developed or CDISC-adopted standard expressions (values) used with data items within CDISC-defined ADAM datasets.
label: ADaM Controlled Terminology Package 58 Effective 2024-09-27
name: ADaM CT 2024-09-27
source: ADaM Controlled Terminology developed by the CDISC Terminology Team in collaboration with the National Cancer Institute's Enterprise Vocabulary Services (EVS)
